Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: RKM HBase AUTHOR: Oracle
DESCRIPTION This Reverse engineering Knowledge Module retrieves metadata about HBase tables and columns. In HBase only Column Families are pre-defined. Columns itself are defined per row. This is why the RKM scans data rows for fetching column names. Only if all rows are scanned, a complete list of column names is guaranteed. Due to data volumes this may not be an option and therefore the extend of the scan can be controlled by KM options listed below.
REQUIREMENTS - HBase or its required jars must be on ODI class path and use the same version as HBase cluster - If used for config, HBase default configuration files must be on ODI class path (hbase-site.xml and hbase-default.xml) - The FlexField "HBase Quorum" on the HBase DataServer must be set Example: rs1.example.com,rs2.example.com,rs3.example.com,rs4.example.com,rs5.example.com
BASIC CONFIGURATION - Make sure that all above requirements have been met - Import this knowledge module into the repository - Create a model, and choose the reverse context as well as the knowledge module in the "reverse" tab. - Execute the reverse engineering and follow up the steps in the logs and inspect log file
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - SCAN_MAX_ROWS: Restrict number of rows in scan - SCAN_START_ROW: Start the scan at a specific row key - SCAN_STOP_ROW: Stop the san at a specific row key - SCAN_ONLY_FAMILY: Restrict scan to certain column families - LOG_FILE_NAME: Log file name
LIMITATIONS - The mask of tables to reverse must not be empty, and at least contain the '%' character. - The tab Selective reverse cannot be used with this knowledge module.
Max row num to be scanned
Specifies the maximum number of rows to be scanned during reversing of a table
Row key to start scan on

Specifies the key of the row to start the scan on ? By default the scan will start on the first row. The row key is specified as a Java expressions returning an instance of org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Bytes. Example: Bytes.toBytes(?EMP000001?)
Row key to stop scan on

Specifies the key of the row to stop the scan on ? By default the scan will run to the last row of the table or up to SCAN_MAX_ROWS is reached. The row key is specified as a Java expressions returning an instance of org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Bytes. Example: Bytes.toBytes(?EMP000999?)
Only applies if SCAN_START_ROW is specified.
Restricts scan to matching col fams

Restricts the scan to column families, whose name match this pattern. SQL-LIKE wildcards % and _ can be used.
By default all column families are scanned.

<% if (isODI12cOrLater) { /*if ODI 12C*/ %> OdiReverseSetMetaData "-MODEL=<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>" -USE_TABLE_NAME_FOR_UPDATE=true <%} else { /*if ODI 10g or 11g*/%> OdiReverseSetMetaData -MODEL=<%=odiRef.getModel("ID")%> -USE_TABLE_NAME_FOR_UPDATE=true <%}%>

<% isODI12cOrLater = !odiRef.getInfo("ODI_MAJOR_VERSION").contains("ODI_MAJOR_VERSION"); %>
<% if (isODI12cOrLater) { /*if ODI 12C*/ %> OdiReverseResetTable -MODEL=<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%> <%} else { /*if ODI 10g or 11g*/ %> OdiReverseResetTable -MODEL=<%=odiRef.getModel("ID")%> <%}%>
